item.title: Milemarker at OR-31/US-395 Junction
item.description: Milemarker 120E at OR-31/US-395 junction. These type of milemarkers with the letter suffix have started to appear around Oregon. The letter indicates the segment of highway that the mileage is for. In Oregon, mile markers are posted according to internal highway, not posted route number (except for intersate highways). In this case the milemarker is for Fremont Highway. A posted highway can be composed of have multiple segments of internal highways.

item.title: End OR-31 South at US-395
item.description: End OR-31 south at US-395. Use US-395 south for Lakeview and Reno (Nevada). Use US-395 north for Wagontire and Burns.

item.title: OR-31 South Approaching US-395
item.description: OR-31 south approaching US-395. This is the southern end of OR-31.

item.title: OR-31 South Approaching US-395
item.description: OR-31 South at US-395 junction. This is the southern end of OR-31.

item.title: OR-31 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-31 south, leaving Summer Lake, Oregon. Distance to Paisley and Lakeview.

item.title: End Silver Lake Marsh Road at OR-31
item.description: End Silver Lake Marsh Road at OR-31. Turn right on OR-31 for Silver Lake. Turn left on OR-31 for La Pine.

item.title: End Fort Rock Road at OR-31
item.description: End Fort Rock Road at OR-31 in rural Lake County.

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-31
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-31. Use OR-31 south for Reno (Nevada).

item.title: US-97 South Approaching OR-31
item.description: US-97 south approaching OR-31. Use OR-31 south for Silver Lake and Lakeview.
